column5: My girlfiend's son, Brandon, & I went out last night for just a quick fish before dark.  The wind had calmed down nicely so I was looking forward to a good topwater bite. I wasn't disappointed. I was throwing my favourite Pop'R (firetiger) while Brandon sped things up with a buzz-bait.  The slower presentation of the popper seemed to be the key. While Brandon only managed one LM about a pound and a half, I must have caught at least a dozen bass (all LM) including these two beauties, both solidly over 4 lbs:     In our haste to get out after dinner, we forgot the camera, so I brought them home in the livewell for some pics, both fish were safely released (hopefully to take up residence under my dock, lol). I've never caught two 4+ bass in one day before, never mind in less than an hour.  Here's hoping for another calm evening tonight.
Very nice for any day let alone a quick fish. Good work
Whew! I'm glad your arms aren't any longer!... just kiddin'!  Nice fish and pic!
i love that.top water is exciting wtg.
Great finding a gal and getting a fishing partner out of it !  Nice fish as a bonus...
yeah nice going!! Topwater POP-R's are my favorite way to go also. Nothing beats seeing a top water strike!!  dsn
Nice largies.  Still waiting for my first bass on a topwater - sounds like its pretty exciting action!  Thanks for posting. 007
WTG - nice fish  We had great action on topwater a couple weeks back - nothing beats the surface explosion!
We need a drooling emoticon here.....so for lack thereof Ill use this one:    Nice fish!!!
Holyu Creap ... They're HUGE.     Very ... Very Nice.
Nice job Jer - congrats on the nice fish
Great job on the topwater! Can really get the heart goin!
LOL! you got to train the photographer to use a little ZOOM that plus long arms= 8 pound largemouth.  Congrats on the nice bass!!!
...I was trying for a pic worthy to send to Ottawa claiming twin 10 pounders...
